4.text:
Food Tubers! Welcome once again, it's your
boy Tim The Human AKA The Vegan Prince in

9.text:
the building. Today I've got a great recipe
for you, it's good for dinner parties, big

20.text:
family occasions, get-togethers, it's a nut
roast flan. It's got a crunchy texture, layers

25.text:
of flavour and it looks delicious. This is
great as a main meal but you can cut it into

30.text:
portions and take it with you if you're on
the go. This recipe serves four people. First

37.text:
things first, the roasting the nuts. We take
50g linseeds, sunflower seeds and pine nuts.

43.text:
Bang them in a baking tray, toast them in
the oven, 5 minutes at 180 degrees.

51.text:
After 5 minutes your nuts are ready to come out
of the oven. Nicely toasted. I'm going to

58.text:
grab a food processor to prepare the base.
Put the nuts in the processor, then we're

62.text:
going to add 100g of chest nut puree. 50g
of suet and a tablespoon of maple syrup. I

69.text:
like maple syrup. Now once that's all in the
processor you're going to mix it up but you're

73.text:
going to have to scrape it down because it's
going to stick to the sides as you go. Right

82.text:
when that's done you're going to take it off
and put it on some baking parchment. Just

88.text:
going to put a bit of gluten free flour onto
the parchment. Scrape out the dough. Now that's

95.text:
ready you're going to start working this into
a base, get lots of flour on your hands and

99.text:
the rolling pin. Going to roll it out to about
5mm thick and you're going to keep flouring

103.text:
the rolling pin so that it doesn't stick.
Now that's spread out, take your tray to measure

109.text:
it out and cut it just slightly bigger than
the base of the tray so that it fits in there

113.text:
with a little rim. This is where you want
to be really gentle with the pastry, take

118.text:
off the trimmings. Come on, we can flip this.
Ready? Now you can see that's in there, we're

127.text:
going to leave the baking paper on and we're
just going to blind bake it, to take some

131.text:
of the moisture out. I'm just going to use
some lentils to weigh it down. Bang that back

134.text:
in the oven. 15 minutes at 180 degrees. Now
that's in the oven, were going to saute your

143.text:
mushrooms. About a tablespoon of rape seed
oil, that's what we're using here. Bang in

148.text:
your mushrooms, for this recipe you're going
to use 300g of chestnut mushrooms, 5-6 minutes

153.text:
on a medium heat, till they're nice and golden.
They've reduced down in size, the moisture's

158.text:
left, put them back in the bowl so we can
use the pan to wilt down the spinach. Another

163.text:
drizzle of oil, 260g of baby leaf spinach,
you can use frozen if you like but fresh is

169.text:
better. Add a pinch of pepper, let that wilt.
Now you're going to want to get your food

174.text:
processor back out. We're creating a new mix.
While your spinach is wilting. 100g of tofu,

178.text:
in it goes. Going to take 1 avocado, I love
any recipe with avocado. Half a lemon. And

186.text:
using a micro-plane just going to add a bit
of nutmeg to taste. Now your spinach has wiltered,

190.text:
add that to the mix and blitz it all together.
Now that's blitzed down, you're going to take

200.text:
your base out of the oven, it's been in there
for 15 minutes, let it cool down and we'll

203.text:
bring all these things together. For now we're
going to leave the filling in the processor,

207.text:
taking a quarter of a sweet potato. Back in
the pan. We're going to peel the potato into

213.text:
the pan on a medium to high heat. Lots of
nice really thin slices so the pan's covered.

217.text:
Going to fry these for about 4 minutes until
they're crisp. Potatoes are done, going to

224.text:
take your base, now it's time to add the layers.
Lovely creamy green spinach and tofu avocado.

231.text:
You can smell the lemon as well. Delicious.
What a treat. Once that's on you want to add

238.text:
your mushrooms to the top, kind of sprinkle
them, spread them out. Then we add the potatoes,

243.text:
look at that. Then to top it off, sprinkle
a few toasted pine nuts. What a delight. Look

249.text:
at the colours, it's like a specialty dish
but accessible for everyone. Look at the contrast,

255.text:
got the brown base, the green, the orange
on top. Those mushrooms cooked off nicely.

261.text:
Four delightful portions there. Smells a dream.
It's damn good. There you have it guys, don't

275.text:
you just want to try that from home. You can
make it for yourself, that's my nut roast

280.text:
flan. If you want to check out other vegan
recipes click right here and if you want to

check out my channel, all vegan goodness,

288.text:
of thing, well being. Check it out right here.
If you like the video give it a like, if you
